name: SALA Samui Resort And Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: They upgraded us from a 50 sqm deluxe room to a beautiful 100 sqm superior garden room with a pool which was nice. The free internet was nice but got annoying after a while. I think they give the same internet login codes to other guests, so whenever you try to login you would have to call and ask for another code because another guests is using yours.
reviews.title: nice but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness center was average and could use improvements, maybe better cardio equipment and a sauna or steam room. Not what I expected from a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: A relaxing stay and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was average, service could have definitely been better. It would have been nice if they had more selection, maybe add another restaurant or two. The staff were friendly for the most part but not that attentive, seems like they tried to avoid eye contact with me whenever I needed something. Their English was poor and it felt like they didn't enjoy being there, they're smiles did not look genuine.
reviews.title: Beautiful set up, great staff, beautiful rooms and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I think this is a good resort but could use some improvements. I just came back from Lebua in Bangkok and the service and food there was excellent. I think what separates a good hotel from a great hotel is the food and service, and unfortunately Sala Samui was lacking in both. I'm not sure what the other resorts are like in Koh Samui but I have stayed at the W, and Four Seasons in other cities and the service there was far superior.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good staff but certain areas need some attention

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff at Sala Samui make the place stand out. Everyone is real friendly - from the airport greeting, to the personalized tour of the property and room at check-in, to the warm greetings and helpful service at breakfast and by the pool.
reviews.title: Fabulous Family Friendly Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent our honeymoon here. We had a wonderful stay, the food quality are good, the room is beautiful, well maintained public area, the staffs are friendly and attentive. We would love to come back for future holidays.
reviews.title: A truly enjoyable experience and stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. Cost was £250 a night on average, for a garden pool villa, which did not include any extras like transfers or use of the spa. For that amount of money you would expect some fantastic service, however, that was not the case. The breakfast was disappointing, with items like eggs or pancakes extra, although the mango's were delicious. They even charged a ridiculous amount for bottlked water at breakfast. The best thing about this hotel is the private pool and the infinity pools. Getting around the island is expensive with fixed prices everywhere (no one uses a meter). As soon as you mention where you are staying the price is hiked up so try mentioning the cheaper hotel next door and negotiating with the drivers.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: 10min from the airport, don't book for garden pool villa noisy, Sala poll are much much better.
reviews.title: :) good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Sala Samui in July 2010 for nearly 2 weeks, with my husband. We were there on honeymoon. From the second we landed we were in ore of the place. Koh Samui airport is bar none the coolest airport I have ever been to. We we met by a thai lady who was soooooooooo friendly and welcoming, she took us to our car and we had a private transfer to our hotel, which on the island was not a long drive at all, 10/20 mins max. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by the staff who were again so friendly and welcoming. We had a bunch of roses given to us and had champayne when we arrived at our room. We stayed in a garden pool villa, it was out of this world. They made the beds everyday, you could have clean towels and bedding everyday. They turned the beds down everyday and came in early evening to spray mosquito spray and light the incense. We rang for room service and they were at the door before we put the phone down. The food in the restaurant was outstanding, and thats for the breakfasts, lunches and mains, albeit slightly pricey. We had 2 cocktails one night and they cost more than a meal at a little thai restaurant on the main street including drinks put together. The swimming pools were fantastic, the sun loungers were amazing. They would come round as you were sunbathing and ask if you want a free massage..... total relaxtion!!! As soon as the staff saw you coming they would lay a towel down for you, or take you to a sun lounger on the beach and do the same.
reviews.title: Amazing from start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all they could not do enough for you! I will definately be returning!!! And I also recommend the beach party form 2pm til late on Chewang beach (a short and cheap taxi ride away)... great for shopping too.
reviews.title: Sala Samui - a peaceful and stylish place in Koh Samui

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't really descripe how amazing it's starting from the villa, the facilities, cleanliness, quiet, very warm staff and people are just wonderful
reviews.title: Amazingggggg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what we read on the website was really less than what we found , it's really amazing and very suitable for honeymooners
reviews.title: Simply Idyllic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: After a rather bad start of our stay in Koh Samui (Abusive publicity from another resort, which will be covered and reviewed under their heading soon), we took the decision to change of accommodation on the spot.
reviews.title: In one word - Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Together with the assistance of the booking.com team we elected the Sala Samui Resort. Despite our un-announced arrival at the resort at late hours, we were very professionally welcomed by the night receptionist Mr. Phan. As no room available in our selected price range, the management kindly upgraded us to a garden pool villa.
reviews.title: heaven on earth!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First "Woaw effect" fulfilled, no doubt!
reviews.title: magic hotel

description: SALA Samui Resort and Spa is a stunning deluxe pool villa resort on Koh Samui island, featuring private swimming pools in 53 out of 69 total villas and suites.At SALA Samui, a comfortable, relaxing ambiance is created by a harmonious blend of traditional Thai architecture with modern facilities and amenities. Friendly, well-trained staff pamper guests with professional, personalized service.Located on pristine Choeng Mon beach on the northeast corner of Koh Samui island, SALA Samui is just 15 minutes from the Samui airport, 20 minutes from Bo Phut's quaint Fisherman's Village, and only 15 minutes from Chaweng Beach shopping and nightlife.
